fields.description:
Confluence will corrupt nested macros inside a unknown macro, leading to data loss in the page storage. The bug lies in the XhtmlContent's implementation and what the class does when a macro definition does not exists or it's not available. When the xhtmlContent.handleMacroDefinitions method is called with a block of xhtml content which contains a reference to a macro module that has been disabled it will return invalid data - such that it ignores the macros that the disabled macro contains and will conflate the parameters of those macros into the disable MacroDefinition. xhtmlContent.handleMacroDefinitions will generates invalid data leading to data loss. In the page we will see this image: !image1.png|thumbnail! And if we edit the page, nothing will appear inside the macro: !image2.png|thumbnail! The storage format shows that the data exist in the page and the following error appears in the logs: {code} handleMacroExecutionException Exception executing macro: jira-form-wrapper, with message: Unable to locate projectKey input, use the blueprint to generate a new form and copy/paste the macro back in to the form. {code} h4. Replicating the issue {code} aaa INLINE


bbb false title

this is some content


{code} The "info" above is the standard info macro and simple macro was a test macro created to just return the body. When this situation arises, a call to xhtmlContent.handleMacroDefinitions will result in the first MacroDefinition passed to the MacroDefinitionHandler.handle method being corrupted - the MacroDefinition will have no body, and all of the parameters of the child macros will be conflated into the corrupt definition. On the event, this bug caused the F4C (Forms for Confluence) migrator to attempt to migrate the content based on invalid data, and thus corrupted the pages. In the test, if we used the following storage format: {code} arg


arg false title

this is some content


false title

this is some content


{code} With both "Simple-macro" and "other-macro" enabled, we get these results from the test plugin (which iterates across the macro definitions found by XhtmlContent and outputs the parameters and values) {code} [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] ---------------------------------- [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] All macros enabled [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] warn [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] icon = false [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] title = title [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] other-macro [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] othermacroarg = arg [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] info [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] icon = false [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] title = title [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] simple-macro [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] simplemacroarg = arg [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] {code} However, if the "other-macro" have it's module disabled, we see that the "warn" macro content disappears and the arguments are conflated ito the "other-macro" definition. {code} [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] ---------------------------------- [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] With other-macro disabled [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] other-macro [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] icon = false [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] othermacroarg = arg [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] title = title [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] info [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] icon = false [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] title = title [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] simple-macro [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] simplemacroarg = arg [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] {code} This will cause data loss on all pages that uses the disabled macro and a separate macro migration tries to use the XhtmlContent to convert markup to MacroDefinition objects so that they can be adjusted and then reformatted out to migrate the content to the new format. h4. Workaround Reverting to the page last version fixes the problem, however not all pages have a previous version so it might require a manual intervention to restore an old backup into a staging instance and manually restore lost page contents to production.
fields.summary: Macros nested inside other macros are corrupted if original macro is disabled or not installed

fields.description:
We just had a look at the new _Atlassian Companion_ feature (https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/edit-files-170494553.html) and noticed that the program is installed to *_AppData\Local_*. This is at least annoying in business environments where users change computers frequently and/or where %localappdata% is deleted on logoff. 
Please consider installing _Companion_ to *_AppData\Roaming_* in user mode and installation to *_Program Files_* for machine wide deployment.
fields.summary: Install Atlassion Companion per machine

fields.description:
The Atlassian Companion app has an option to "Launch on startup", which creates a registry entry in Windows, for just that.
 There is an issue with Windows however, where sometimes, it's unable to launch a program if there's space in between a user name.

For example,
 *Does not work:* C:\Users\user name\AppData\Local\atlassian-desktop-companion\Atlassian Companion.exe --was-opened-at-login
 *Works:* C:\Users\username\AppData\Local\atlassian-desktop-companion\Atlassian Companion.exe --was-opened-at-login

This seems to be a Windows issue, since it should be able to launch the app, even if the path has spaces in it, but it just does not work on certain Windows install for some reason.
 [https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/all/on-startup-windows-tries-to-open-a-file-but-cant/420aae7f-be93-4f6b-9bc5-b75d01c0fca0]
 [https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2919286/getting-the-username-from-the-hkey-users-values]
 [https://superuser.com/questions/479105/how-can-i-format-this-path-to-work-as-registry-key-value]
 [https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/windows_10-other_settings/windows-10-upgrade-issue-with-space-in-username/3ea1a411-2c59-4d2a-bda1-d48b9793231f]

*Workaround:*
 We can workaround the issue by editing the registry entry, and add quotes around the whole path.
 *HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\com.squirrel.atlassian-desktop-companion.AtlassianCompanion*"C:\Users\user name\AppData\Local\atlassian-desktop-companion\Atlassian Companion.exe --was-opened-at-login".

This works, but once the App starts, it updates the path again, and removed the quotes, and so we have to do this again before restart, after the app starts.

*Suggestion:*
 We should add quotes around the path as a preventative measure, so that users with this issue are able to have the app launch on startup.
fields.summary: Companion app's "Launch on startup" does not work if Windows user has username with spaces

h3. Summary

The JIRA Charts macro cannot be added through the *Macro Suggestions* and from the Macro Browser when no JIRA is connected to it
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Server 6.11.0
 * Confluence Server 6.9.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Type \{jira} to bring out the Macro suggestion in the page
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-20 at 13.43.15.png|thumbnail!
 # Highlight JIRA Charts and press enter to include the macro

OR
 # Click on the + icon to bring out the macro browser
 # Click on the JIRA Charts macro to add it to the page

h3. Expected Results

The user is informed that there is no Jira instance or that there is an issue with their application links.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens. Pressing enter does not include the macro into the page
h3. Workaround

Ensure that a JIRA instance is connected to the Confluence instance when adding the JIRA Charts macro. The dialog will be displayed as expected:
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-21 at 08.23.04.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence lazily loads classes. As such, after start up, it's possible that Confluence won't have certain classes loaded in memory and this can lead to slower load times and timeouts. In this specific case, we are seeing a timeout on first load when attempting to view the mobile version of a Confluence instance. 
h3. Environment
 * Confluence
 * Mobile device

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start Confluence
 # From a mobile device, access the base url for Confluence

h3. Expected Results

The page will render as expected.
h3. Actual Results

The user receives a timeout. A reload of the page renders the page as expected.
h3. Workaround

N/A
h3. Notes

At the minimum, it would be helpful if there was some sort of message that said that loading the classes was happening in the background and to be patient. But a timeout leads the user to believe that there may be a problem occurring.
fields.summary: Mobile servlet can time out on first load post start up

fields.description:
When Confluence is set behind a reverse proxy, and incoming traffic is not allowed, using any internal gadgets opens up a HTTP thread, and clicking on the internal gadgets multiple times will eventually exhaust all HTTP threads, causing Confluence to hang, or crash.

This behavior is similar to CONFSERVER-39393, where when Confluence is unable to access external gadgets, opening up the gadgets causes Confluence to use up it's HTTP threads.

In this case, the issue is fixed by allowing incoming traffic from Confluence server to the load balancer.

The issue is that the errors and symptoms of this issue is similar to CONFSERVER-39393, and as such, it's not immediately apparent what the issue is.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Add a proxy configuration for tomcat in server.xml (e.g. proxyName confluence.xyz where confluence.xyz is a load balancer or webserver).
 # On the confluence.xyz loadbalancer, do not permit incoming traffic from the Confluence application server. Confluence will (mostly) still work, except for gadgets.
 # On Confluence, click on Insert > Macro. This will cause the page to spin and timeout. Do this 48 times (or whatever your maxThreads is set to).

*Result:* 
 # Confluence is no longer accessible and needs reboot. There are errors in the log hinting at what may have happened but it is not immediately clear.

*Expected:*
 # There should be a clearer log message or perhaps add a health check that would fails. The current situation where there is a time-delayed crash after some use is not too easy to debug.
fields.summary: Improve log, or error message for when Confluence is unable to access itself, when set behind a reverse proxy

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-56557].
{panel}
*Summary*
 * Edit Files using Atlassian Companion may not work on specific terminal server environments when using multiple desktops concurrently. 
 * Each desktop session on the server must have a +separate (virtual) network interface+ for the Atlassian Companion to work.  

 
----
Steps to reproduce
 # The first user tries to edit the document and receives a prompt to download and install the Atlassian Companion app which then gets installed into their user profile. And they can open the document correctly.
 # The second user logged on to the same Terminal Server tries to open a different document using Atlassian Companion (the second user will not be prompted to install the Atlassian Companion – instead the document will open on the first user’s desktop)
 # If the first user shuts down the Atlassian Companion by clicking Quit in its tray menu, the second user will now be prompted to download and install the Companion app and the second user able to open documents on their second user desktop.
 # If another user tries to edit a document using Atlassian Companion it will open on the second user’s desktop.

Environment
 * Operating System: Windows Server 2012 R2.

Expected Result
 * Editing a file using Atlassian Companion will show on the same desktop session.

Actual Result
 * Editing a file using Atlassian Companion will show on the previous desktop session that has Atlassian Companion running.

Workaround
 * If the user already done using the Atlassian Companion to close the Atlassian Companion.
fields.summary: Atlassian Companion app does not work with session-based virtual desktops or virtual app streaming

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding an @mention to a Confluence page and save the page, the cursor is placed at the beginning of the username so no text can be appended.

h3. Environment
* Safari 11.0.3 
* Confluence 6.10.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add an @mention and click “Return”
# Publish the page
# Edit the page 
# Put the cursor at the end of the @mention

h3. Expected Results
The cursor remains at the end of the mention.
h3. Actual Results
The cursor is placed in front of the username as shown below: 
!cursor.png|thumbnail!

No text can be added on that line following the @mention

h3.Workaround
This is not occurring in Firefox or Chrome, so you can use either browsers as a workaround.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you create a Space and the title/spacekey contains 'was', it is not searchable to other users. Pages that contain the word 'was' is also not searchable. For example, when you search for 'I was', only i is highlighted in the search.

!highlighted i.png|width=564,height=265!
h3. Steps to replicate
h4. Space
 # Create a space called 'WAS' and set the permission to 'Everyone can view and edit".
 # Search for space called 'WAS'. While typing for 'was' in the searchbox, you will see an error 'The query could not be parsed'.
 # Click 'Enter'. Then, user will get an error :
{panel}
No results found for *was*. Please try one of the following suggestions:
 * 
 ** Use more general search terms or [consult the online documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Search+Syntax] for tips.
 ** If you are filtering by space, content, last modification date or contributor, try removing or adjusting the filter{panel}

h4. Page
 # Create a page called 'WAS' and set the permission to 'Everyone can view and edit".
 # Search for a page called 'Was', or page that contains the word 'was'. While typing for 'was' in the searchbox, you will see an error 'The query could not be parsed'.
 # Click 'Enter'. Then, same error is observed.

h3. Expected results

User should be able to search for the space and pages containing 'was'.
h3. Actual results

User is not able to search for the space containing 'was'.
fields.summary: The word 'was' is not searchable.

fields.description:
This has been reproduced on Windows 7 and Windows 10, using Firefox and Chrome.
 *Confluence versions tested*: 5.10.2 , 6.0.5, 6.3.2, 6.10.1

When using *Ditto* or *AutoHotkey* (clipboard manager applications), if you paste some text in the Page, and then hit the Undo button (or Ctrl+Z), the text will still be published upon saving the Page.
The only difference is whether the Collaborative mode is turned ON or OFF.

If the *Collaborative Editing is ON*, the text will break into multiple lines and will not disappear from the screen at all. Upon Saving the Page, the text will be appended at the end of the Page and published as if the "Undo" button was never used.
Video demonstration: [https://screencast-o-matic.com/watch/cFjo6fqIYq]

If the *Collaborative Editing is OFF*, the text will initially disappear when hitting the Undo button, but once the Page is saved/published, it will be appended on the bottom of the Page.
Video demonstration: [https://screencast-o-matic.com/watch/cFjo6QqIYa]

This behavior is reproducible using two different 3rd Party Apps, [Ditto|https://ditto-cp.sourceforge.io/] and [AutoHotkey|https://autohotkey.com/]

Thanks,
Nikola Radenovic | Atlassian Support
fields.summary: When undoing a paste, the text is appended at the end of the page

fields.description:
h2. Summary
There's an internal Hibernate Adapter Map used to support Hibernate API Versions 2 and 5. The purpose of the map is to translate exceptions and other tasks from one version to another. This map can get corrupted, which can cause threads to get stuck when executing the WeakHashMap method, which is not thread safe and can lock the entire application.

h2. Symptoms
Application tasks that rely on achieving connections from the database, such as the Index, may stop working, since the WeakHashMap locks all threads who doesn't have a connection to the database yet.  There may be other operations that can be impacted too.

The way to identify this scenario is by taking thread dumps, where we see the majority of the threads in either Blocked or Waiting statuses, while there's only one thread in Runnable status, executing a WeakHashMap:
{code}
"http-nio-8091-exec-492" daemon prio=5 tid=0x00000000000022bb nid=0 runnable 
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.util.WeakHashMap.get(WeakHashMap.java:403)
	at com.atlassian.hibernate.adapter.adapters.HibernateExceptionAdapter.adapt(HibernateExceptionAdapter.java:35)
	at com.atlassian.hibernate.adapter.adapters.session.SessionV2Adapter.connection(SessionV2Adapter.java:161)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager.doBegin(HibernateTransactionManager.java:422)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.hibernate.ConfluenceHibernateTransactionManager.doBegin(ConfluenceHibernateTransactionManager.java:41)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.getTransaction(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:373)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor54.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:302)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:202)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy34.getTransaction(Unknown Source)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionAspectSupport.createTransactionIfNecessary(TransactionAspectSupport.java:427)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionAspectSupport.invokeWithinTransaction(TransactionAspectSupport.java:276)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:96)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:208)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy36.retrieve(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.bandana.ConfluenceCachingBandanaPersister.lambda$retrieve$0(ConfluenceCachingBandanaPersister.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.bandana.ConfluenceCachingBandanaPersister$$Lambda$359/1698215470.get(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.vcache.SynchronousExternalCache.lambda$get$10(SynchronousExternalCache.java:236)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.vcache.SynchronousExternalCache$$Lambda$361/2117426375.get(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.metrics.TimedSupplier.get(TimedSupplier.java:32)
	at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.service.AbstractStableReadExternalCache.lambda$null$5(AbstractStableReadExternalCache.java:116)
	at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.service.AbstractStableReadExternalCache$$Lambda$375/922126746.get(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.Optional.orElseGet(Optional.java:267)
	at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.service.AbstractStableReadExternalCache.lambda$get$6(AbstractStableReadExternalCache.java:114)
	at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.service.AbstractStableReadExternalCache$$Lambda$368/1620586459.call(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.service.AbstractExternalCache.perform(AbstractExternalCache.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.service.AbstractExternalCache.perform(AbstractExternalCache.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.service.AbstractStableReadExternalCache.get(AbstractStableReadExternalCache.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.metrics.TimedExternalCache.get(TimedExternalCache.java:67)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.vcache.SynchronousExternalCache.get(SynchronousExternalCache.java:236)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.bandana.ConfluenceCachingBandanaPersister.retrieve(ConfluenceCachingBandanaPersister.java:78)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.bandana.ConfluenceCachingBandanaPersister.retrieve(ConfluenceCachingBandanaPersister.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.bandana.DefaultBandanaManager.getValue(DefaultBandanaManager.java:32)
	at com.atlassian.bandana.DefaultBandanaManager.getValue(DefaultBandanaManager.java:24)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.settings.DefaultSettingsManager.getGlobalSettings(DefaultSettingsManager.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.status.service.DefaultSystemInformationService.getConfluenceInfo(DefaultSystemInformationService.java:97)
	at org.apache.jsp._500page_jsp._jspService(_500page_jsp.java:306)
{code}

h2. Steps to Replicate
It is unclear on how the application would get into this state.

h2. Workaround
Unfortunately, the only way to clear the stuck thread is to restart the application.
fields.summary: Hibernate Adapter Map is not Thread Safe

fields.description:
h3. Note - this issue is not present in Confluence 6.11
h3. Summary

When using custom URL fields in JIRA, and including them as a column in the JIRA Issue Macro, URLs are simply displayed as text and not as a url.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA
 # Add a custom field
 ** I selected the URL custom field
 # Create an issue with a URL in the custom field
 # Install Confluence
 # Connect Confluence and JIRA with an application link
 # Create a page in Confluence
 # Insert a JIRA Issue Macro
 # Click Display Options
 # Add URL as a column
 # Save the page

h3. Expected Results

The URL in the URL field is clickable
h3. Actual Results

The URL in the URL field is rendered as plain text
h3. Notes
 * The URL field in JIRA itself does provide a clickable link

h3. Solution / Workaround
 * None currently
fields.summary: Custom URL field in Jira  displayed as plain text in Confluence 6.10

fields.description:
Hi Team,

We are currently using Confluence server version(6.8.2) on internal AWS system. The current application on AWS is divided into the below modules:

EC2 instance(on which we have application and home directories, attachments and other user data)

Database- RDS(hosted on postgreSQL v9.4.15)

Now we want to upgrade confluence to the latest version and migrate it to the Datacenter. As part of this activity, we have already created a test environment on AWS based on the ATL and AMI scripts provided by Atlassian here: [https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-aws-deployment/src/4d30f76f1c197167e56200fa2623c407a3fd550f/ami/scripts/init.d/?at=master] 

The test environment we have has got the following modules:(all provisioned in AWS)

Two confluence node servers

Load Balancer

Database(postgreSQL v9.5.10)

Now the challenge is to migrate the database from our production environment to the test environment(datacenter). The production database is using the default database and schema settings that came with the standalone installation of confluence. But on datacenter environment, as we setup the database using ATL and AMI scripts, the schemas and the database user seems to be different. Could you please assist us with the following queries so that we will be able to proceed with our migration:

So we would like to know how can we proceed with the migration of data so that we can have exact production replica on the test environment. What are the ways that we can do this?

And also, if we skip the database migration and opt for confluence site export and import does it replicate the application data as expected?

Does site export and import takes into account the personal spaces and also the unpublished drafts? Or does it only imports published pages?

Many thanks!

Best Regards,

Monika
fields.summary: Migration help from Confluence Server to Data center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no way of changing the placeholder text in the [Questions for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211644/questions-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] search box.

In Space, the search box would have a hard-coded placeholder text as below:
{code}
What do you want to know about <Space Name>?
{code}
 !Search Box.png|thumbnail! 
In some cases, the <Space Name> will not make sense for the users as they are not asking questions for the Space Name, but some of the pages in this space instead.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admin to customize the placeholder text for the search box
fields.summary: Allow admin to change the Placeholder text for Questions for Confluence search box

h3. Summary
It's not possible to set up a default project and issue type for issues that are created by highlighting text in Confluence using the application linls.

# Have a Confluence and Jira setup with application links working
# Highlight a text in Confluence and create a task/issue

* A default project and issue type will be already selected

fields.description:
h2. Problem Summary
On the JIRA side, there is a configurable parameter called [{{jira.search.views.max.limit}}|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-increase-the-jira-search-results-limit-on-the-issue-navigator-357696242.html] which limits the number of issues returned within a JIRA search. If this value is set to "-1", which denotes "unlimited", then the JIRA Issues Macro will fail to render issues inside of Confluence. The max number of issues will continue to be displayed, but not the listing of issues themselves.

h2. Steps to reproduce
# In JIRA, set {{jira.search.views.max.limit}} to "-1" in jira-config.properties
# Start up Confluence and JIRA
# Create an applink so Confluence can pull in issues from JIRA
# In JIRA, create a project and a couple of test issues
# In Confluence, insert a JIRA Issues Macro and use an issue filter which returns multiple results
# Save the Confluence page

h2. Expected results
Confluence displays JIRA Issues in the JIRA Issues Macro

h2. Actual results
The number of issues found are returned in the macro, but not the listing of issues themselves:

 !jim_table.png! 

h2. Workaround
* On the JIRA side, set "jira.search.views.max.limit" to a non-unlimited value (the default is 1000).
* Related KB: https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/jira-issues-macro-shows-an-empty-table-with-no-issues-but-shows-the-total-number-of-issues-when-displaying-in-table-mode-690849922.html
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro does not display issues when "jira.search.views.max.limit" is set to "-1" (unlimited) on the JIRA side

h3. Summary
When you set the Collab. Editing status to 'limited' and then restart Confluence, its status is changed back to 'on'.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the *Collaborative Editing* page.
# Change its status to "limited".
# Restart Confluence.
# Go to the *Collaborative Editing* page.

h3. Expected Results
The status will remain set to "limited"

h3. Actual Results
The status is reverted to {{on}} and if you edit a page with different users, you will see that it will work, so it is not only a problem with the status page.

h3.Workaround
* Change the status to 'OFF'. This will mode will not be reverted.

fields.description:
KB article: https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/surviving-database-connection-closures-297665664.html 
advises to add two parameters in order to enable validation query: 
<property name="hibernate.c3p0.validate">true</property>
<property name="hibernate.c3p0.preferredTestQuery">select 1</property>

Starting from Confluence 6.5.0 only 
<property name="hibernate.c3p0.preferredTestQuery">select 1</property> is added, first parameter is not added which is correct according to 

https://developer.jboss.org/wiki/HowToConfigureTheC3P0ConnectionPool

h5. Action required:
* Update https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/surviving-database-connection-closures-297665664.html 
** from sections *FOR POSTGRESQL, SQL SERVER*  AND MYSQL and *FOR ORACLE*  remove line: <property name="hibernate.c3p0.validate">true</property>
fields.summary: update KB: Surviving Database Connection Closures

fields.description:
XML backup is failed if JIRA AO tables are created by third party add-on.
 (for the details, [https://valiantys.atlassian.net/browse/SPREAD-272])

According to ["Could not read fields for table" error when creating an XML backup in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/could-not-read-fields-for-table-error-when-creating-an-xml-backup-in-confluence-306348859.html], there is only one workaround which the problematic table is dropped before starting XML backup.
 The workaround is invalid for Jira which enabled the daily XML backup by scheduler.

We recognize that you don't recommend XML backup in [Site Backup and Restore|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/site-backup-and-restore-163578.html], but this article is not mentioned the problem which related AO table.
 So we assume that there should be the workaround without dropping AO table.
fields.summary: Add other workaround to resolve XML backup error without droppig AO tables

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

With Collaborative Editing *Off* the following situation exists:
* New drafts can't save attachments via upload attachment option.
* Drafts of existing pages can save attachments, as usual.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Ensure Collaborative Editing is Off.
# Create a new page, give it a title and a few line.
# Select *Close*.
# From the profile picture navigate to Drafts.
# Open the draft for editing again.
# Upload attachment via *Insert files and images* option.

h3. *Expected Results*

The attachment should upload to the draft.

h3. *Actual Results*

The attachment pop-up never gives the option to *Insert*. The only option is to *Close*.

h3. *Workaround*
Try one of the following two:
# Drag and Drop the attachment on to the editor.
# Enable Collaborative Editing.

h3. *Diagnosis*

Confluence returns a 400 bad request to the request from the browser.
{code}
        "request": {
          "method": "GET",
          "url": "http://localhost:26101/c6101/rest/api/content/1376273/child/attachment?expand=version,container,space&_=1533779492837",
.
.
  "text": "{\"statusCode\":400,\"data\":{\"authorized\":false,\"valid\":true,\"allowedInReadOnlyMode\":true,\"errors\":[],\"successful\":false},\"message\":\"The entity Draft = { id: 1376273, type: page, title: saving a second draft, pageId: 0, pageVersion: 0} is not ContentConvertible or API available\",\"reason\":\"Bad Request\"}"
{code}

The symptoms are similar to CONFSERVER-38719.

If we try an upload again, we see the following error.
 !server_ unavailable.png|thumbnail! 

In application logs, we see something like following. 
{code}
2018-08-09 12:32:55,098 WARN [http-nio-26101-exec-1] [confluence.impl.hibernate.ConfluenceHibernateTransactionManager] doRollback Performing rollback. Transactions:
  ->[com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.service.content.AttachmentServiceImpl$AttachmentFinderImpl.fetchMany]: PROPAGATION_REQUIRED,ISOLATION_DEFAULT,readOnly (Session #564908989)
 -- referer: http://localhost:26101/c6101/pages/createpage.action?useDraft=true&spaceKey=~admin&draftId=1376296& | url: /c6101/rest/api/content/1376296/child/attachment | traceId: 9bae05c239ca5de7 | userName: admin
{code}
h3. *Additional Notes*

Upon testing this in Confluence v6.6.7, this issue doesn't happen. This version actually uses a different request method to upload attachments.
{code}
        "request": {
          "method": "GET",
          "url": "http://localhost:2667/c667/rest/prototype/1/content/1146888/attachments.json?_=1533780994036",
{code}
fields.summary: Drafts can't save attachments via insert option, with Collaborative Editing Off

h3. Summary

Non-admin users are unable to download attachments inside of an Answer, in Confluence Questions, when the question is attached to a space.

Additionally, admins and users are also unable to preview/download attachments attached to a Question in the Confluence Questions plugin when the question is attached to a space.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 6.8.x, 7.4.x
 * Confluence Questions 2.6.x, 2.7.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new question
 # After entering a title and body, click the drop-down in the top right to *Ask in a space*
 # Start typing out a space name, and select a space which appears
 # Assign a topic to the question
 # Click Save
 # Answer your test question above with some text
 ** *Before* submitting the text answer, Click the *Insert Link* icon at the top of the editor to upload a file
 ** Click *Files* on the left, then click *Browse* and upload a file
 ** Click *insert* to attach the file to the question
 # Click Save to save the answer

h3. Expected Results

Anyone can download the attachment from the answer:
 !no-repro.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

Non-admin users cannot download attachments from the question, even if they have permissions to download attachments in the space to which the question is attached:
 !reproduced.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

This only seems to affect questions which are tied to space. Creating questions independent of a space does not seem to trigger this issue.

fields.description:
h3. Description:
Confluence application allows Copy Page and Copy Page Tree actions to be executed while Move page is already in process on the same page. This creates a race condition and can cause attachments to go missing on both source and destination pages. Due to the timing required to reproduce this condition, this tends to affect larger page trees which are being copied/moved simultaneously
 
h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a page with subpages and few attachments. 
 # Click on "..." and select Move page to another space.
 # Immediately click <- (Back) on the browser or refresh the browser.
 # Now click "..." again and select Copy action on the same page.
 # Select to copy the page tree and choose a different destination from the move
 # Now check attachments on the source and destination pages for the move and the copy actions

h3. Expected behavior:
Confluence should prevent running Copy action while Move action is in process and ideally inform the user in the UI of what's going on behind the scenes
 
h3. Actual behavior:
Copy actions trigger even when Move is already running. This causes many attachments to go missing from the filesystem on both source and destination pages

h4. Details:
In local testing, it appears that the page move will move the attachments to a new location on the filesystem. However, the page moves themselves will fail due to a copy being done at the same time. This results in the pages not being actually moved, but attachments are all moved (and can no longer be found in the UI).

At the same time, the copy tree is successful, but none of the physical attachments are copied over since they're now "missing" from the expected original places in the filesystem.

Finally, the original source pages are now also missing attachments since they've been moved despite the move page action failing. Trying to access the attachments from various pages will lead to the following errors in the UI:

!Null-pointer.png|thumbnail! !Attachment-not-found.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Confluence should not allow another action while one is already been executed on a Page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Node startup time takes more than 30 minutes for data center deployment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install data center via de AWS cloudformation template
# Load a lot of data (https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/marketplace/testing-your-app-with-a-large-data-set/)
# Scale up the cluster with an extra node

h3. Notes
The delay is caused by a {{chown -R in /etc/rc.d/init.d/atl-init-confluence}}, specifically in function {{configureSharedHome}}. This chown -R takes about 30 minutes on the mounted storage and while it might make sense in certain setups, in this case it seems totally superfluous.

fields.description:
If the RSS Feed macro processes a feed that contains a link within a CDATA element that is prepended with a space, it will display the following message: "_Error rendering macro 'rss' com.atlassian.confluence.macro.MacroExecutionException: Illegal character in scheme name at index 0: <url_being_processed>_"

Within the logs, an error message like the following will appear:
{code}
2018-07-27 12:08:52,883 ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-1] [plugins.macros.html.RssMacro] successfulResponse Error while trying to assemble the RSS result!
 -- url: /display/ABC/Technology+Talks | page: 94339230 | traceId: 4fd80848d009deca | userName: rjones | referer: https://wiki.xyz.com/display/ABC/Technology | action: viewpage
java.net.URISyntaxException: Illegal character in scheme name at index 0:  https://www.cnet.com/#ftag=CAD590a51e 
	at java.net.URI$Parser.fail(URI.java:2848)
	at java.net.URI$Parser.checkChars(URI.java:3021)
	at java.net.URI$Parser.checkChar(URI.java:3031)
	at java.net.URI$Parser.parse(URI.java:3047)
	at java.net.URI.<init>(URI.java:588)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.macros.html.RssMacro.verifyLink(RssMacro.java:178)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.macros.html.RssMacro.verifyLinksInFeed(RssMacro.java:168)
{code}

Within the feed (CNET's feed used as an example), the embedded URL appears like this:

<link><![CDATA[ https://www.cnet.com/#ftag=CAD590a51e ]]></link>

fields.description:
h2. Summary
The steps to reproduce this problem is unknown. However, the Support team has observed that in multiple customer environments, page restrictions can get into a state which prevents all users from viewing/editing a page (except site admins in the "confluence-administrators" group). An examination of the database confirms that the page contains a restriction, but no user or group is named to be part of that restriction. This effectively blocks *all* users from viewing or editing the page.

h2. Symptoms from the UI
A red lock appears at the top of the affected page, indicating that there is some sort of page restriction. However, when clicking on the lock, the restrictions dialog appear blank and says that there are no page restrictions

h2. Diagnosis via the database
The *CONTENT_PERM_SET* table will contain a row which references on the affected page, indicating a View and/or Edit restriction is indeed on the page. This causes the red lock to appear in the UI. However, there is no corresponding row in the *CONTENT_PERM* table, which keeps track of which users/groups are applied to the restrictions in the first table. This causes the restrictions dialog to come up blank.

In short, the bug is that there is a row in CONTENT_PERM_SET which locks down the page, but no corresponding row in CONTENT_PERM to complete that restriction.

h2. Workaround
# The following query can be used to identify pages affected by this condition:
{code}
SELECT c.contentid, c.title
FROM CONTENT_PERM_SET cps
JOIN CONTENT c
  ON cps.content_id = c.contentid
WHERE cps.id NOT IN (
  SELECT cps_id
  FROM CONTENT_PERM )
GROUP BY c.contentid, c.title;
{code}
# Using a site admin/super user (i.e. someone in the "confluence-administrators" group), visit the pages returned by the above query
# Explicitly add a View restriction and save. This has the effect of overwriting the bad data with an actual page restriction.
# Finally, remove the View restriction and save. The page will now be unlocked
fields.summary: Users restricted from pages due to invalid data in CONTENT_PERM_SET and CONTENT_PERM tables

After some testing, we have figured out that this issue is reproduced because the macros are nested within other macros. Effected SR Macros: * *{{combining-reporter}}* * *{{expanding-reporter}}* h3. Environment * Confluence h3. Steps to Reproduce # Set up Confluence 6.3.4 instance and install add ons: Source Editor & [Service Rocket Reporting|https://marketplace.servicerocket.com/product/reporting-plugin] # Import the following XML into a page and save: {code:java} page:descendents


page:children


comment page:all comments page:children


{code} 3. Input the following searches into the search box:  * macroName:expanding-reporter* * macroName:combining-reporter* *OR* * macro = expanding-reporter * macro = combining-reporter h3. fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using Confluence AWS CloudFormation Template, you have the option to turn off collectd service. When you turn this off, Synchrony nodes fail to provision. On the other hand, the same works fine for the Confluence nodes.

h3. Environment
* AWS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# [Run Confluence Data Center on AWS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf64/running-confluence-data-center-in-aws-936511800.html#RunningConfluenceDataCenterinAWS-DeployingConfluenceDataCenterusingtheAWSQuickStart]
# In the CloudFormation Template (ref: https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-aws-deployment/src/931335e712e8cca1e35324f817d07c33a59427fb/templates/ConfluenceDataCenter.template)
# Set the collectd attribute to False
# Start provisioning the cluster

h3. Expected Results
Confluence and Synchrony nodes should be provisioned without a problem

h3. Actual Results
Provisioning Synchrony nodes fails and you get the following error
{code:borderStyle=solid}
2018-08-06 13:50:02,908 [DEBUG] CloudFormation client initialized with endpoint https://cloudformation.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com
2018-08-06 13:50:02,908 [DEBUG] Describing resource SynchronyClusterNodeLaunchConfig in stack poc-confluence-dev
2018-08-06 13:50:03,023 [INFO] -----------------------Starting build-----------------------
2018-08-06 13:50:03,024 [DEBUG] Not setting a reboot trigger as scheduling support is not available
2018-08-06 13:50:03,024 [INFO] Running configSets: default
2018-08-06 13:50:03,025 [INFO] Running configSet default
2018-08-06 13:50:03,026 [INFO] Running config 1
2018-08-06 13:50:03,026 [ERROR] -----------------------BUILD FAILED!------------------------
2018-08-06 13:50:03,027 [ERROR] Unhandled exception during build: 'unicode' object has no attribute 'iteritems'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/aws/bin/cfn-init", line 171, in <module>
    worklog.build(metadata, configSets)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/cfnbootstrap/construction.py", line 129, in build
    Contractor(metadata).build(configSets, self)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/cfnbootstrap/construction.py", line 530, in build
    self.run_config(config, worklog)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/cfnbootstrap/construction.py", line 542, in run_config
    CloudFormationCarpenter(config, self._auth_config).build(worklog)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/cfnbootstrap/construction.py", line 227, in build
    for manager, packages in sorted(self._config.packages.iteritems(), cmp=CloudFormationCarpenter._pkgsort):
AttributeError: 'unicode' object has no attribute 'iteritems'
{code}
 

h3. Workaround 
The issue seems to be a typo in the template. The current workaround is to modify the CloudFormation template on line 825 and add "!" before {{Ref "AWS::NoValue"}}. This is the snippet that is related to the Synchrony part:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
  SynchronyClusterNodeLaunchConfig:
    Type: "AWS::AutoScaling::LaunchConfiguration"
    DependsOn:
      - EFSMountAz1
      - EFSMountAz2
      - DB
    Metadata:
      AWS::CloudFormation::Init:
        configSets:
          default: [1]
        "1":
          packages:
            !If
              - DoCollectd
              - yum:
                  collectd: []
                  collectd-java: []
                  collectd-generic-jmx: []
                  collectd-rrdtool: []
                  collectd-disk: []
              - !Ref "AWS::NoValue"
{code}
fields.summary: Confluence CloudFormation Template fails to provision Synchrony nodes when not using collectd

In Confluence 6.11, the edit files feature requires the installation of a desktop client called "Atlassian Companion." Currently this is only available via download as a .exe file via Confluence or the Atlassian documentation website. This is not ideal for companies that require a standard operating environment as they cannot easily roll it out to their users.
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of September 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

Thank you for your patience on this issue. This update is to let you know that the Microsoft Installer (MSI) for the Atlassian Companion app is ready.

The MSI is available to download on our [Administering the Atlassian Companion App documentation page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/administering-the-atlassian-companion-app-958456281.html].  

Best,

Victoria Li | Product Manager - Confluence Server 
{panel}

fields.description: Mediawiki sends an email if you are watching a page, but allows you to then not receive any additional emails until you visit the page. This is incredibly helpful for pages you are watching that have high volumes of updates. For example we have a page tracking updates to a certain project that has 10-15 updates an hour. Even with email batching, I'm getting 5-6 emails per hour. The additional emails don't provide value, as I can mark the first one for follow up and get to it when I have a chance, and I can use the page history if I really want to see the diffs between individual revisions. If there's any way this functionality could be brought to Confluence, it would be much appreciated. Thanks!

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using the Ctrl + Arrow key to skip words in the Collaborative Editor does not work.

When using this keyboard shortcut, it will skip words, however when you reach the end of the paragraph or line, the cursor gets lost. This requires the user to take the cursor and place it in the location they want to type.

h3. Environment
This issue is reported following environment:
 * Firefox "Quantum" 61.0.1 or above
 * Windows
 * Confluence 6.x and above

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Confluence 6.x or above in Firefox on Windows
 # Open the editor
 # Type a line of words
 # Click Control+ Right Arrow to move the cursor over words
 # Continue to do so till you get to the end of the line
 # Hit Enter to create a new line beneath
 # Try to use Control + Left Arrow to navigate back to the end of the first line

h3. Expected Results
The cursor returns to the end of the first line.

h3. Actual Results
The cursor is lost.
  
h3. Notes
This appears to be related to Collaborative Editing, since this behavior is not seen in versions before Confluence 6.x
h3. Workaround

Use the cursor to return to the end of the first line.

fields.description:
h4. Issue Description
As the link generated in the email is a static page URL, if there is changes in the page title after the email notification is sent, the page won't be accessible by the link directly anymore.

h4. Expected Result
User get redirect to the correct page

h4. Actual Result
User received a "Page Not Found" message as the title of the page is no longer the same.

h4. Suggested Resolution
Using a *tiny URL* or *pageid* will be a better approach.
fields.summary: Links in emails stop working after changing a page's title

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a Confluence System Administrator I would like to be able to manage users and groups directly from REST API endpoints. Automation and scripting of user management can be made easier with REST API.
h3. Problem statement

User and groups management is currently not possible via REST API only. Bulk operations, automation or scripting of management actions is not currently possible when using REST API. User management was previously possible with SOAP, which has been deprecated.
h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide methods akin to what as present with SOAP that would allow Admins to manage users and groups via REST API.

 

 

 

_Previous Ticket Description_
 As Confluence is popular tool used by many users, it should provide the API to add users to groups, similar to what Jira Cloud has.
fields.summary: Provide REST API methods to manage users and groups

fields.description:
h2. Issue Summary

It is currently possible to get into a state where Collaborative Editing is off and the page history still shows multiple contributors.
h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Turn off Collaborative Editing.
 # Publish a new page (Page History will show it as V1 - Version 1).
 # Edit this page as User A and User B at the same time.
 # User A and User B commit their changes to the page, creating two new versions.
 # Page History shows a version (V3) *Changed By* both users:
!Screen Shot 2018-07-30 at 16.57.25.png|thumbnail!

h2. What happened?

An entry was added to the DB with users A and B as collaborators of v3.
h2. What should have happened?

Only one of the users should have contributed to version 2 and 3.
fields.summary: A collaborator relation is added when two users save their drafts with collab editing off

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you select the "CalDAV" option on the "Subscribe to calendar" panel, the URL is not changed when you select a different calendar. According to [Subscribe to and from Team Calendars|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/subscribe-to-and-from-team-calendars-273285883.html], the *root* URL will be used.

This implies that the application that will subscribe to Team Calendar will have a calendar discovery. However, if the application doesn't have a calendar discovery, it will not be able to fetch the events from Team Calendars from a specific calendar.
h3. Environment
 * Team Calendar 6.0.17
 * Confluence 6.9.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Team Calendars.
 # Create two calendars.
 # Click on the "Subscribe" option.
 # Select "CalDAV" and the calendars created.

h3. Expected Results
 * The URL given by Confluence will have different endpoints for each calendar.
or
 * Gray out the "calendar" selection and display a warning saying that the application must have calendar discovery, as it happens with Outlook.

h3. Actual Results

The same URL is given for different calendars.

!Screen Shot 2018-08-01 at 1.49.12 PM.png|thumbnail!  
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-01 at 1.49.20 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

If you select Thunderbird, it will have a url {{/caldav/}} and different endpoint for each individual calendar.
h3. Workaround

No workarounds
fields.summary: CalDAV URL not able to select different calendars

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Quick Search does not list pages in recently updated first order, despite documentation stating so, it appears that quick search is heavily influenced by last accessed and ignores recently modified. In fact, the most recently modified page goes to the bottom of the search.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

On Confluence 6.10.0
 # Created 5 pages in sequence *1, 2, 3, 4, 5*, so *5*th is the last to be modified and *1* is the oldest
 # Accessed them one by one in the same order: *1, 2, 3, 4, 5* and back to space homepage
 # Click on QuickSearch and see pages in reverse order from top to bottom, *5, 4, 3, 2, 1*
 # Type in "page" into quick search, pages are displayed in *5, 4, 1, 2, 3*
 # Go back to page tree, and access pages in reverse order: *5, 4, 3, 2, 1* and then home
 # In QuickSearch, pages listed as *1, 2, 3, 4, 5*
 # Type in "page", pages are still listed *1, 2, 3, 4, 5*
 # Logged in as another user and edited page *4*
 # Switched back to the original user and refreshed the page, QuickSearch recent page list remained the same: *1, 2, 3, 4, 5*
 # Typing "page" changed list to *1, 2, 3, 5, 4*

h3. Expected Results

Defined and documented order in which quick search results are meant to be sorted as if it's last accessed or last modified.
 If there are additional algorithms that can influence quick search results, those should be documented too.

According to [Search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/search-139528.html] documentation:
{quote} * Items are ordered with the most recently updated first{quote}
Above is clearly not respected.
h3. Actual Results

It is unclear as to what logic or order quick search results are displayed in. The same scenario was tested on 5.10.8 and behaviour is identical.
fields.summary: Quick Search results are not ordered with the most recently updated first

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a "Custom Event Type" completely deleted from a Calendar notifications are not sent out via e-mail like they are for singular events nor is a backup of those events sent like when one deletes the whole calendar.

This causes problems as we do not have restrictions nor audit trails for Team Calendars. A user can come in and delete an entire calendar with no record.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an e-mail notification and backup of the calendar during deletion.
fields.summary: Provide Email alert for Deleting Custom EvenT Type

fields.summary: Not able to expose REST API, when plugin is bundled as obr

fields.description:
When we create a XML backup with attachments, the XML file is created with a folder called attachments, however the [attachments hierarchical structure|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/hierarchical-file-system-attachment-storage-704578486.html] is changed completely and most of the path is removed, leaving only page IDs.
 !attachment_structure_difference.JPG|thumbnail! 
 !attachment_structure_difference_2.JPG|thumbnail! 

In case the XML does not import some attachments, we cannot manually import the entire attachment folder from the zip as workaround.

This is specially problematic for Cloud migrations to Server instances, since missing attachments during the import cannot be manually imported by copying de attachments folder from the XML zip to the data_directory/attachments.

Suggestion:

We should create the XML zip file with the complete and unchanged attachment hierarchical path that its used within a Confluence data directory. This will avoid confusion when checking for missing attachments and at the same time should make the attachments manual copy possible when the import procedure doesn't work correctly for some attachments.
fields.summary: Make XML backup attachment hierarchy path the same as from original data directory

Now we can't migrate to SELS 15, because SLES 15 does not support MySQL any more. It´s only MariaDB supported.

Same Problem with OpenSuse Leap 15 und many other Linux Distributions.

 

Hardy
fields.summary: Please add MaridDB Support for Conluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the Clear Formatting option is used on selected on text, the inline comments added to the text will be cleared.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a new page, type text "Hello World". Change Text Formatting (as an example choose "Monospace"). 
 # Save the page.
 # Add an inline comment to the text "Hello World".
 # Edit the page. Then, select the Monospaced text and Select "Clear Formatting" from the Editor Toolbar. Save page.
 # It is observed that the Inline comment will be gone once the page is saved. 

h3. Expected Results

Inline comment will still be there until the user clicked 'Resolve'.
h3. Actual Results

Inline comment is gone and will be automatically moved to 'Resolved'.
h3. Notes

Appears to affect all Text Formatting options, Superscript, Subscript, and Strikethrough
h3. Workaround

Select Formatting to be removed from Editor Toolbar rather than selecting 'Clear Formatting'.
fields.summary: Clearing the format of a text will remove the inline comment added to the text.
